messages.text:
On Oct 31, 2011, at 1:52 PM, Russ Cox wrote:

> On Mon, Oct 31, 2011 at 16:47, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
>> i have text ready for review, and will send it out once the error cls go in. we should include these edits in the error release.
> 
> In that case, please send the CL out, and I will submit
> it as part of the error snapshot.  Andrew and I try to coordinate
> so that the error snapshot happens very shortly after the
> normal one.

i can't send it out in complete form, since the programs need to be incorporated. what i can generate now would be incorrect.

i suppose i could patch your CL, but not run the programs.

-rob

On Mon, Oct 31, 2011 at 15:16, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
> what sounds good? there were two possibilities there.

i will leave the docs for you to update in a
CL after the weekly.

russ

Hello r (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

you need to regenerate the tutorial with the updated programs.

but there's a lot more work to do here and i think the issue should be handled differently in the text. if you want to check this in to get a good build, OK, but i am happy to do the real work that's needed and you can leave the whole thing to me if you choose.

-rob

On Mon, Oct 31, 2011 at 15:06, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
> you need to regenerate the tutorial with the updated programs.
>
> but there's a lot more work to do here and i think the issue should be handled differently in the text. if you want to check this in to get a good build, OK, but i am happy to do the real work that's needed and you can leave the whole thing to me if you choose.

sounds good.
yes, i was expecting that there will need to be a pass
over all the docs for many different things.  since this
won't hit golang.org until go 1, it seems okay for now.

russ

On Oct 31, 2011, at 12:08 PM, Russ Cox wrote:

> On Mon, Oct 31, 2011 at 15:06, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
>> you need to regenerate the tutorial with the updated programs.
>> 
>> but there's a lot more work to do here and i think the issue should be handled differently in the text. if you want to check this in to get a good build, OK, but i am happy to do the real work that's needed and you can leave the whole thing to me if you choose.
> 
> sounds good.
> yes, i was expecting that there will need to be a pass
> over all the docs for many different things.  since this
> won't hit golang.org until go 1, it seems okay for now.

what sounds good? there were two possibilities there.

-rob

i have text ready for review, and will send it out once the error cls go in. we should include these edits in the error release.

-rob
actually i can stage it by changing how the String() call is done (by deleting it).

On Mon, Oct 31, 2011 at 16:47, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
> i have text ready for review, and will send it out once the error cls go in. we should include these edits in the error release.

In that case, please send the CL out, and I will submit
it as part of the error snapshot.  Andrew and I try to coordinate
so that the error snapshot happens very shortly after the
normal one.

Thanks.
Russ

subject: code review 5311069: doc/progs: use Error method
